hints.label: lem-expected-distance-change
hints.title: Expected Cross-Distance Change
hints.content:
714: :label: lem-expected-distance-change
715: 
716: Under the cluster-preserving coupling {prf:ref}`def-cluster-coupling`, the expected change in population-level cross-distance $D_{IJ}$ after cloning in swarm 1 is:
717: 
718: $$
719: \mathbb{E}[\Delta D_{IJ}] \leq -\bar{p}_I \cdot c_{\text{geom}} \|\mu_x(I_1) - \mu_x(J_1)\|^2 + O(\delta^2)
720: 
721: $$
722: 
723: where:
724: - $\bar{p}_I = \frac{1}{|I_1|} \sum_{i \in I_1} p_{1,i}$ is the average cloning probability in target set
725: - $c_{\text{geom}} > 0$ is a geometric constant from the cluster alignment
726: 
727: **Proof:**
728: 
729: Consider a walker $i \in I_1$ (target set) with cloning probability $p_{1,i}$.
730: 
731: If $i$ clones from a walker $j_1 \in J_1$ (companion in complement set), the position updates:
732: 
733: $$
734: x'_{1,i} = x_{1,j_1} + \zeta_i
735: 
736: $$
737: 
738: where $\zeta_i \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \delta^2 I_d)$.
739: 
740: The change in squared distance to a walker $j_2 \in I_2$ (target set in swarm 2) is:
741: 
742: $$
743: \begin{aligned}
744: \Delta_{ij_2} &:= \|x'_{1,i} - x_{2,j_2}\|^2 - \|x_{1,i} - x_{2,j_2}\|^2 \\
745: &= \|x_{1,j_1} + \zeta_i - x_{2,j_2}\|^2 - \|x_{1,i} - x_{2,j_2}\|^2
746: \end{aligned}
747: 
748: $$
749: 
750: Taking expectation over $\zeta_i$:
751: 
752: $$
753: \mathbb{E}_{\zeta_i}[\Delta_{ij_2}] = \|x_{1,j_1} - x_{2,j_2}\|^2 - \|x_{1,i} - x_{2,j_2}\|^2 + d\delta^2
754: 
755: $$
756: 
757: Using the identity $\|a - c\|^2 - \|b - c\|^2 = \|a - b\|^2 + 2\langle a - b, b - c\rangle$:
758: 
759: $$
760: \mathbb{E}_{\zeta_i}[\Delta_{ij_2}] = \|x_{1,j_1} - x_{1,i}\|^2 + 2\langle x_{1,j_1} - x_{1,i}, x_{1,i} - x_{2,j_2}\rangle + d\delta^2
761: 
762: $$
763:

hints.label: lem-target-cloning-pressure
hints.title: Cloning Pressure on Target Set
hints.content:
806: :label: lem-target-cloning-pressure
807: 
808: For any walker $i \in I_k$ (target set), the cloning probability satisfies:
809: 
810: $$
811: p_{k,i} \geq p_u(\varepsilon) > 0
812: 
813: $$
814: 
815: where $p_u(\varepsilon)$ is the N-uniform constant from Lemma 8.3.2 in [03_cloning](03_cloning), line 4881.
816: 
817: **Proof:**
818: 
819: By definition, $I_k = U_k \cap H_k$ where $U_k$ is the unfit set.
820: 
821: Lemma 8.3.2 ([03_cloning](03_cloning), line 4881) states:
822: 
823: > For any walker $i$ in the unfit set $U_k$, its total cloning probability is bounded below by a positive, N-uniform, and $\varepsilon$-dependent constant $p_u(\varepsilon) > 0$.
824: 
825: Since $I_k \subseteq U_k$, the bound applies to all $i \in I_k$.
826: 
827: The explicit formula (from Section 8.6.1.1, line 5334):
828: 
829: $$
830: p_u(\varepsilon) = \min\left(1, \frac{1}{p_{\max}(V_{\text{pot,max}} + \varepsilon_{\text{clone}})} \cdot \frac{f_F f_U \kappa_{V,\text{gap}}(\varepsilon)}{(k-1)(f_F + f_U^2/f_F)}\right)
831: 
832: $$
hints.raw_directive:
